item_description: Deploy anti-stalkerware detection tools to identify monitoring applications. Scan for apps with excessive permissions including location, microphone, camera, and message access.
Implement strong device authentication. Disable installation from unknown sources. Maintain physical control of devices.
Obtain a separate device for sensitive communications if stalkerware is suspected. Removing stalkerware may alert the monitoring party.
Maintain current OS versions. Security updates frequently patch vulnerabilities exploited by stalkerware.
Engage professional forensic analysis to identify monitoring software and preserve evidence.
Device battery depletes faster than baseline due to continuous background data transmission.
Increased mobile data consumption without corresponding user activity. Monitor per-app data usage for unknown processes.
Device runs hot during idle periods indicating background process activity.
Adversary demonstrates knowledge of private communications, locations, or activities accessible only through device monitoring.
Presence of unrecognised apps, device administrator privileges, or configuration profiles.
Use tracker detection applications to scan for nearby Bluetooth tracking devices. Enable platform-native unknown tracker alerts.
Conduct systematic inspection of vehicles for GPS tracking devices in common concealment locations.
Inspect bags, clothing, and frequently carried items for concealed tracking devices.
If tracker discovered, document location and preserve for evidence before removal. Removal alerts monitoring party.
Device displays alerts for unknown tracking devices travelling with user.
Adversary references specific locations, routes, or timing not disclosed by target.
Small electronic device found attached to vehicle or concealed in belongings.
Periodic beeping from unknown source in belongings or vehicle.
Review all location sharing configurations across devices and services. Disable unauthorised sharing.
Migrate to individual accounts for services previously shared. Use new credentials unknown to adversary.
Assess family phone plan features that expose location or usage data. Plan migration to individual account.
Adversary references location, purchases, or activities visible through shared account access.
Audit reveals location sharing enabled with adversary's account.
Unrecognised devices listed in shared account trusted device lists.
Configure maximum privacy settings on all social media platforms. Restrict visibility of posts, connections, and activity.
Review all followers and connections for adversary-controlled accounts. Remove suspicious connections.
Avoid posting real-time locations, routines, or future plans. Delay posting until after events conclude.
Disable or require approval for tags and mentions to prevent third-party location disclosure.
Adversary references social media activity that should not be visible given current privacy settings.
New follower accounts created recently with minimal activity or connections to adversary's network.
Contacts report adversary has shown them target's social media content or asked about online activity.
Check email settings for unauthorised forwarding rules and filters. Remove rules forwarding to unknown addresses.
Review and remove unrecognised devices linked to messaging accounts.
Use end-to-end encrypted messaging for sensitive communications. Ensure adversary cannot access linked devices.
Change voicemail PIN. Disable remote voicemail access where possible.
Messages marked as read before target has viewed them. Account shows online status during non-use periods.
Email settings contain forwarding rules to unknown addresses or filters moving messages automatically.
Messaging app settings show unrecognised devices with active sessions.
Adversary quotes or references private message content.
Transfer device ownership to sole-controlled account. Factory reset devices and reconfigure with new credentials.
Identify all cameras, microphones, and recording-capable devices. Disable or remove devices that cannot be secured.
Disable remote access features, drop-in capabilities, and voice purchasing. Delete stored recordings.
Adversary references conversations or activities that occurred inside the home.
Cameras activating, indicator lights engaging, or voice assistants responding without user trigger.
Smart home app settings show adversary account retains admin or viewer access.
Change router admin credentials. Factory reset router if adversary configured it.
Use VPN to encrypt internet traffic and prevent network-level monitoring.
Use mobile data instead of home network for sensitive browsing.
Adversary references websites visited or searches performed.
Router contains parental controls, content filtering, or logging not configured by target.
Discovery of network monitoring software or devices on home network.
Review and remove unauthorised calendar sharing permissions across all calendar applications.
Use separate calendar on adversary-unknown account for sensitive appointments.
Change credentials on health portals. Remove adversary as authorised contact.
Adversary appears at calendar events they should not know about.
Adversary references upcoming appointments before disclosure.
Audit reveals adversary retains calendar viewing access.
Limit sensitive information shared with contacts who maintain relationship with adversary.
Identify which contacts may relay information to adversary based on information leakage patterns.
Share unique details with specific contacts to identify information relay sources.
Adversary gains knowledge of information shared only with specific individuals.
Contacts ask unusually specific questions about location, plans, or relationships.
Trusted contacts report adversary has requested information about target.
Unlink health and fitness accounts from shared or adversary-known accounts. Create new accounts with private credentials.
Disable public profiles, activity sharing, and social features on fitness platforms.
Factory reset wearable devices and configure with sole-controlled account.
Adversary references exercise patterns, sleep data, health metrics, or location data from fitness tracking.
Audit reveals fitness or health apps sharing data with adversary's account.
Fitness tracker connected to adversary-controlled account.
Use password manager with strong master password. Generate unique passwords for all accounts.
Enable MFA on all accounts using authenticator app on secure device.
Use privacy screens. Avoid password entry where adversary can observe.
Change all passwords after separation, starting with email accounts.
Login notifications from unrecognised devices or locations.
Unable to access accounts with previously valid credentials.
Adversary demonstrates knowledge of account-specific content.
Document all account details including usernames, associated contacts, and creation dates for recovery purposes.
Change recovery email and phone to adversary-unknown contacts.
Contact platform support for account recovery. Many platforms have DFV-specific recovery processes.
Unable to access accounts. Password reset attempts fail or redirect to unknown contacts.
Contacts report changes to profile content not made by account owner.
Account recovery reveals changed backup contacts or security questions.
Configure multiple recovery options so compromise of one does not eliminate account access.
Use fictitious answers to security questions that adversary cannot guess from personal knowledge.
Secure recovery email account with strong unique credentials and MFA.
Receiving confirmation of password or security changes not initiated by account owner.
Notifications of backup email, phone, or security question changes.
Regularly review active sessions on all accounts. Terminate unrecognised sessions.
Use 'sign out all sessions' feature after credential changes.
Session review shows sign-ins from unrecognised devices or locations.
Settings changed or content accessed without user action. Review platform activity logs.
Remove device from adversary's Find My/Find My Device account.
Migrate device to sole-controlled Apple ID or Google account. Factory reset if required.
Device displays lock screen or lost mode message without user action.
Device factory resets without user initiation.
Use authenticator app on secure device rather than SMS-based 2FA.
Contact carrier to add SIM lock PIN and port-out protection.
Use hardware security key for highest-risk accounts.
Sudden loss of mobile service may indicate SIM swap attack.
Receiving 2FA codes without initiating login attempts.
Change passwords and enable MFA on cloud storage. Review and remove sharing permissions.
Enable encrypted backups where available.
Sign-in alerts for cloud services from unfamiliar devices or locations.
Adversary demonstrates knowledge of cloud-only content.
Systematically separate shared accounts for streaming, utilities, and subscriptions.
Document all shared account details before separation.
Shared services cancelled, passwords changed, or access revoked without discussion.
Adversary uses shared account access to monitor activity or make changes as control mechanism.
Maintain regular backups to adversary-inaccessible storage.
Maintain physical control of devices. Store evidence in secure cloud storage.
Files, photos, or messages disappearing without user action.
Devices physically damaged or factory reset during adversary access periods.
Remove parental control software and MDM profiles. Factory reset if removal not possible.
Leave family sharing groups that grant adversary administrative control.
Apps blocked, websites inaccessible, or features limited by parental controls not installed by user.
Screen Time or similar tools sending activity reports to adversary's account.
Screenshot and save all threatening messages with timestamps and sender details.
Report threats to platform and police. Preserve evidence for legal proceedings.
Establish communication boundaries. Block on platforms where no legitimate contact required.
Messages containing explicit or implicit threats of harm or adverse consequences.
Message tone becoming increasingly aggressive or menacing over time.
Maintain log of all unwanted contact with dates, times, platforms, and content.
Block adversary on all platforms. Configure email filters to archive messages for evidence.
Contact phone carrier to report harassment and implement call blocking.
Unreasonable number of contact attempts across channels.
Simultaneous contact attempts across multiple platforms.
Maintain blocks across platforms. Enable unknown sender filtering.
Report new accounts to platforms for ban evasion.
New accounts using familiar language patterns or referencing personal details.
Contact via channels not previously used after blocking on primary platforms.
Block and report all participating accounts. Report coordinated harassment pattern to platform.
Temporarily restrict account access and disable comments during active campaign.
Report serious coordinated harassment to eSafety Commissioner or equivalent body.
Rapid increase in negative interactions from multiple accounts.
Multiple accounts using similar language, talking points, or hashtags.
Audit and remove personal information from public sources. Opt out of data broker sites.
Use PO Box for mail. Register domains with privacy protection.
If doxxed: report to police, request content removal, alert workplace, document everything.
Private information appears on public platforms.

item_name: Stranger Harassment Based on Published Details
item_description: Contact from unknown individuals referencing doxxed information.
Notify local police of false report risk. Request address flagging in dispatch system.
Prepare for calm interaction with emergency services. Brief household members.
Emergency services arrive in response to unrequested call.
Multiple false reports correlating with relationship events.
Regularly backup social media content using platform export tools.
Appeal account restrictions with context about weaponised reporting pattern.
Content removed or account restricted for non-violating posts during conflict periods.
Platform communications indicating multiple reports against account.
Report humiliating content to platform. Report to regulatory body for serious content.
Request deindexing of harmful content. Create positive content to influence search results.
Posts containing embarrassing or private content about target.
Contacts report encountering harmful content online.
Report fake accounts to platform using impersonation reporting process.
Inform contacts of fake accounts and request verification through trusted channels.
Contacts report receiving messages from accounts impersonating target.
Profiles using target's name, photos, or information discovered.
Flag false reviews for removal. Provide evidence of fraudulent origin.
Respond professionally to false reviews. Request genuine client reviews to counterbalance.
Negative reviews from non-genuine accounts correlating with conflict events.
Decline in business correlating with review attack.
Configure email filtering to manage volume. Unsubscribe from spam subscriptions.
Consider temporary contact change while maintaining bombarded accounts for evidence.
Dramatic increase in spam, subscriptions, or marketing messages.
Confirmation emails from services never subscribed to.
Use AI detection tools to identify synthetic content for evidence purposes.
Report automated abuse patterns to platforms rather than responding to individual items.
Messages that are formulaic, vary slightly while making same points, or arrive at unrealistic volumes.
Media with artifacts characteristic of synthetic generation.
Preserve original communications using platform export tools with metadata.
Use platform records with headers and metadata rather than screenshots for evidence.
Include trusted witness in important communications for corroboration.
Adversary-presented records don't match target's records of same communication.
Messages deleted or content changed from what target recalls.
Screenshot settings and configurations to establish baseline. Log device states to detect changes.
Verify noticed changes with trusted person before doubting own perception.
Enable and check version history on shared documents to detect manipulation.
Device settings or file locations changed without user action. Check modification timestamps.
Increasing self-doubt about digital actions aligning with adversary's claims.
Report NCII to eSafety Commissioner or equivalent body with legal content removal powers.
Register images with StopNCII.org to prevent re-upload on participating platforms.
Report to police. NCII is criminal offence in most jurisdictions.
Intimate images found on public platforms or reported by contacts.
Adversary threatens to share intimate images as leverage.
Report deepfake intimate content to regulatory body and police. Deepfakes treated equivalently to real NCII.
Restrict access to facial photos on social media to limit deepfake source material.
Intimate content surfaces that depicts events that never occurred. May show AI artifacts on close inspection.
Adversary threatens distribution of content depicting situations that never happened.
Develop response strategy with support services. Share truth selectively with key contacts.
Document each false claim with evidence contradicting it for legal proceedings.
Contacts becoming distant without clear reason based on adversary communications.
Trusted individuals report false information being shared by adversary.
Preserve complete communication threads and surrounding context.
Conduct important discussions in writing on platforms maintaining complete records.
Adversary shares real but misleading content stripped of surrounding context.
Third parties confront target about statements that are technically real but misleading without context.
Do not comply with demands. Compliance typically leads to escalating demands.
Contact regulatory body and law enforcement sextortion support resources.
Messages demanding money or compliance in exchange for not distributing intimate content.
Increased demands following initial compliance.
Verify online relationship identity through video calls and reverse image search before trust development.
Never send money or financial information to online-only contacts.
Person consistently avoids video calls or in-person meetings. Photos may belong to someone else.
Increasingly urgent requests for financial assistance with compelling stories.
Set up alerts for own name. Regular self-search to identify harmful content early.
Create professional content under own name to influence search results.
Seek legal advice about defamation action or court-ordered content removal.
Name search reveals websites containing false or harmful content designed to rank highly.
Websites registered using target's name containing harmful content.
Review and restrict visibility of old content that could be weaponised.
Prepare contextual explanations for known historical content with support team.
Historical content shared in new contexts timed to important events.
Evidence adversary systematically archiving target's historical content.
Engage forensic specialist to analyse suspected fabricated evidence and provide expert testimony.
Request official platform records for critical communications. Harder to fabricate than screenshots.
Presented evidence doesn't match target's records or memory of events.
Digital evidence contains impossible timestamps, missing metadata, or editing artifacts.
Use separate secure device for sensitive communications with support services.
Verify directly with contacts if relationships deteriorate unexpectedly.
Contacts report receiving messages from target's accounts not sent by target.
Support relationships deteriorate without clear cause.
Periodically check blocked contacts and email filter rules for unauthorised changes.
Maintain backup contact methods for key support people.
Contacts report sending messages that were never received.
Contacts on blocked list that user did not block.
Recognise demands to control social media connections as controlling behaviour. Document demands.
Maintain separate private account for support connections if needed.
Demands to unfriend specific people, restrict posting, or delete accounts.
Adversary comments on or confronts about social media connections and interactions.
Remove parental controls from adult devices. Factory reset if removal not possible.
Maintain access to secondary device adversary cannot control.
Device has time limits, app restrictions, or content filters not configured by user.
Support websites, apps, or communication tools blocked at device or network level.
Proactively inform key contacts about adversary's potential false information campaign.
Ensure professionals (therapist, lawyer, caseworker) are aware adversary may contact them.
Contacts suddenly withdrawing support or becoming hostile based on adversary communications.
Support people report adversary has contacted them.
Appeal bans with context about coordinated reporting campaign.
Maintain connections across multiple platforms and in-person support.
Banned from communities without clear policy violation.
Community administrators report multiple reports received in short timeframe.
Use separate safe device for sensitive communications if monitoring disclosed.
Have professional assess actual monitoring capability to calibrate response.
Adversary states they can monitor communications, either as threat or demonstrated through knowledge.
Target stops seeking help or being honest in communications due to monitoring fear.
Memorise key helpline numbers. Use mobile data or public computers to access blocked resources.
Use mobile data, change DNS settings, or use VPN to bypass network-level blocking.
Support resources inaccessible on home network but work on mobile data.
Helpline numbers or support bookmarks removed from devices without user action.
Obtain copies of critical identity documents. Store in adversary-inaccessible location.
Secure access to government portals under sole-controlled credentials.
Cannot access digital identity documents due to adversary-controlled storage.
Digital documents moved, deleted, or password-protected without user action.
Check email settings for unauthorised forwarding rules and filters.
Check phone settings and carrier account for call forwarding configurations.
Emails, messages, or calls that senders confirm were sent but never received.
Audit reveals email forwarding or call forwarding to unknown destinations.
Change passwords, enable MFA, remove adversary as authorised user on individual accounts.
Contact financial counsellor experienced in DFV situations for guidance.
Maintain separate emergency fund in adversary-unknown account.
Unable to access financial accounts using previously valid credentials.
Notification of removal from shared financial accounts.
Open individual account at different institution for sensitive transactions.
Use cash or prepaid cards for purchases to keep private.
Adversary references specific purchases, amounts, or merchants from bank transactions.
Transaction alerts configured to adversary's contact information.
Establish independent financial access: personal account, credit card, superannuation access.
Consult lawyer about financial rights and emergency relief options.
Card declined despite available funds, or daily limits reduced without consent.
Spending limits or approval requirements enabled without user action.
Enable real-time transaction alerts on all financial accounts.
Report unauthorised transactions to financial institution and police.
Transactions appearing on accounts not authorised by account holder.
Account balances lower than expected or funds moved without knowledge.
Consult about coerced debt pathways. Debts incurred under duress may be dischargeable.
Document coercion circumstances for legal proceedings.
Threats, intimidation, or manipulation to make transactions or take on debt.
Increasing debt from pressured financial decisions.
Verify investment opportunities independently through regulatory body resources.
Report suspected investment fraud to consumer protection and cyber security agencies.

item_name: Pressure to Invest in Unverified Platforms
item_description: Urged to invest on unfamiliar platforms that cannot be independently verified.
Invested funds cannot be withdrawn from platform.
Ensure all payments directed to sole-controlled account. Update payment details with agencies and employers.
Verify no mail redirection configured without knowledge.
Government benefits, salary, or other payments not arriving in expected accounts.
Direct deposit information changed without authorisation.
Set up credit monitoring. Request credit reports from all reporting bodies.
Place credit ban to prevent new applications. Available free for DFV victims.
Report identity theft to national identity support service.
Credit report shows accounts or enquiries not initiated by owner.
Bills or collection notices for services never subscribed to.
Transfer all smart home device accounts to sole control. Factory reset and reconfigure.
Ensure manual overrides available for all smart home-controlled utilities.
Heating, cooling, lighting, or locks changing without user action.
Unusual utility bills resulting from remote environmental manipulation.
Inform employer about potential for adversary workplace contact if safe to do so.
Secure professional accounts with strong credentials and MFA.
Employer or colleagues report contact from adversary about target.
Job applications unsuccessful potentially due to adversary contact with prospective employers.
Register essential services under own name and billing.
Request DFV support pathway from service providers for expedited account changes.
Phone, internet, insurance, or utilities cancelled without knowledge or consent.
Service plans modified or features removed without notification.
Disable all location sharing, remove trackers, secure location-revealing accounts, vary routines.
Develop comprehensive safety plan with support service addressing technology-enabled tracking.
Report stalking and tracking to police. Apply for intervention order with technology-specific conditions.
Adversary appears at locations not disclosed to them.
Threats that reference specific location or recent movements.
Disable location services. Strip metadata from images. Avoid tagging safe location digitally.
Use new device and accounts. Only communicate location to those who must know via secure channels.
Adversary appears near or references safe location. Immediate safety emergency.
Shared photos contain GPS coordinates revealing safe location.
Vary routes, departure times, and transport methods.
Keep appointments off monitored calendars. Arrange support person accompaniment.
Adversary appearing along travel route or at destinations.
Adversary demonstrates knowledge of travel plans before arrival.
Change all smart lock credentials. Remove adversary access. Replace with traditional locks if needed.
Change all locks after separation. Most jurisdictions require landlords to do this for DFV situations.
Smart locks engaging or disengaging unexpectedly. Access codes no longer working.
Locked inside or outside home due to remote lock manipulation. Safety emergency.
Change connected car credentials. Remove adversary from vehicle account access.
Have mechanic inspect for tracking devices and tampering. Check OBD-II port.
Vehicle functions activating without user action — horn, lights, locks, engine.
Notifications showing adversary's device accessing vehicle features.
Audit all smart home devices. Factory reset and reconfigure under sole-controlled account.
Change Wi-Fi passwords. Remove adversary access to router admin.
Smart home devices activating without user command — alarms, lights, speakers, TV.
Temperature or comfort settings changed remotely to create discomfort.
Inform healthcare provider of DFV situation. Request security review of connected medical devices.
Restrict health record access. Change patient portal credentials. Remove adversary as authorised contact.
Connected medical device settings changed without user action. Contact healthcare provider immediately.
Adversary demonstrates knowledge of health information they should not have access to.
Develop comprehensive anti-stalking safety plan with police and support service.
Maintain detailed stalking log documenting every incident. Use stalking documentation tools.
Adversary repeatedly appears at different locations at varied times.
Evidence adversary involved others in surveillance or uses multiple tracking methods.
Inform police of false report risk. Request address flagging.
Report false emergency calls as criminal offences. Gather evidence reports are fabricated.
Authorities arrive based on reports not made by target.
Learning false reports filed against target by adversary or associates.
Use court-approved co-parenting apps for documented communication.
Audit children's devices for monitoring. Manage parental controls.
Document technology abuse through custody arrangements for family court.
Adversary checking children's location more than reasonably required.
Co-parenting apps used for hostile messages rather than genuine co-parenting.
Monitoring software on children's devices enabling household surveillance.
